text:
You ignore ChatGPT.

But that's how I stay consistent on Linkedin:

☑ Find your best writing pieces (on Linkedin?).
☑ Create a document with their copied pasted text.
☑ Download these texts as TXT. files.
☑ Now go to ChatGPT and start a new Project.
☑ Upload all of your TXT. files.

Then I like to start a conversation with this prompt:

"Tell me about my writing style inside the files I uploaded in this Project. What makes it special?"

Then once ChatGPT answered (in "Instant" mode), I switch it to "Thinking" mode + extended thinking.

I then prompt it:

"Write with this special style you just referred to, and after reading my files again inside this project, write a post about [your topic]".

To go deeper, you must leverage your settings.

1. Go to 'personalization'
2. Find 'custom instructions'. 
3. Select 'enable customization'. 
4. Create a prompt for your custom instructions.

To copy mine, go to: https://lnkd.in/dCjcTz_A.
